Articles.Content:
I'm looking for a KSP hat. A real one, not one for my Kerbalnauts. I checked out the CafePress shop, and they don't have hats--lots of shirts, mugs, etc. Does anyone know if A) I can get one somewhere? or If I can use the logo to make MY OWN (not selling them, I just want one for myself).

Seems like I could find answers to this somewhere, but nope. So I came here. Thanks!
Generally there is never an issue with making your own stuff as long as you don't sell it, even if it's copyrighted(I'm not a lawyer and this may depend on your country, so I might be wrong).
No one can forbid you to make your own. There isn't such law in any country as far as I know.
I have asked and been told that it's okey-dokey, as long as you're not selling them.

I know you can make your OWN stuff, but most printing companies have rules against producing goods with copyrighted images, even if it's just for you. I use CafePress for other stuff, so I'll give it a shot and see if they raise any flags. Thanks!
Personal use? Not for profit or distribution? Go ahead.

Unless you are one of the ~6 people that have internet access in North Korea,its perfectly fine to make your own hats out of KSP if you dont plan to make money off of them/distribute them.Although I don't really know the copyright laws in North Korea.
Gosh, it sure would be swell if they added them to their product line! *nudge, nudge*

Hats? Why not helmets?

Just think of it! A life-sized EVA helmet would go perfectly with a Halloween costume!

Although, it may be pretty expensive...

But it'd be worth it!
